column4: hi. can someone help me with pitivi? i rendered a file but there is no video in it.. just audio.
you sure its not your player that dosent have the proper codec/setup for teh video file?
i exported it to output.avi and used vlc.
see what teh file, or ffprobe command say about the file. and run vlc from a terminal and see if it mentions any video codecs.
tried command prompt. i dont see anything ..
this is what i get with ffprobe: http://pastie.org/1093372
the ffprobe command is a tool ive recently learned about that can give some good info on various video files also.  :) lets see what it sayz
it does seem the avi is either curruptd.. or  a odd codec... that is interesting
it says unsupported codec. i wonder which codec it is talking about..
that makes no sence.
why not?
you partition 'hard drives' and put filesystems on them...
an archive is a collection of files.....
im talking about an archive.
so.. what EXACTLY are you trying to do?
there are collections where there are multiple archives that when extracted become the complete data
you mean make a 'split' rar archive then?
yes. if thats what its called
check the rar man pages . or use some other archiver format.
i tried reading tar man page. didnt see any option
tar would be doing it old skool..  via tar, and the split/join/cat commands...
if you want to use 'rar' you would want the rar man pages/docs.
any suggestions for the right tool? command line
